messages.content: ComfyUI-SaveAVIF is a custom node on ComfyUI that saves images in AVIF format.
Can workflows be loaded from images saved using ComfyUI-SaveAVIF?
Yes, workflows can be loaded from images saved at the ComfyUI-SaveAVIF node.
ComfyUI-SaveAVIF can be used in the same way as the Save Image node in ComfyUI.
Does encoding to AVIF using ComfyUI-SaveAVIF take time?
Yes, encoding to AVIF using ComfyUI-SaveAVIF takes a little time.
What does the c_quality setting in ComfyUI-SaveAVIF do?
The c_quality setting in ComfyUI-SaveAVIF sets the quality for color on a scale of 0 to 100, where 100 is lossless.
What does the enc_speed setting in ComfyUI-SaveAVIF do?
The enc_speed setting in ComfyUI-SaveAVIF determines the encoder speed on a scale of 0 to 10, where 0 is the slowest/smallest and 10 is the fastest/largest.
What does ComfyUI-SaveAVIF output when encoding is finished?

When encoding is finished, ComfyUI-SaveAVIF outputs an image, which is a pass-through of the input. This output can be used to notify the end of encoding, such as by connecting a node that plays a sound.
ComfyUI-SaveAVIF can be installed using ComfyUI Manager or by cloning the GitHub repository and installing the requirements using pip.
